intro: Flemingia pauciflora, commonly known as the slender flemingia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, flat pods that contain several seeds. Flemingia pauciflora is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological importance in its native habitats.
